website_summaries.verdict: Not only is it extremely convenient to get the information you need at a glance from its large HD display, it carried over the greatest features from the Echo family of smart speakers.
pros: Easy to set up and use
Huge catalog of visual content to watch from Amazon App store

website_summaries.verdict: If you like the idea of a smart display for cooking, calling or watching videos, the newest Echo Show is a great option. But don't expect any extras.
pros: The second generation of the Echo Show brings a better and bigger display, fuller sound and YouTube via Firefox or Amazon Silk browsers
cons: There still aren't many useful or entertaining animations in common Alexa interactions

customer_reviews.title: Can't see the time from a few feet away....
customer_reviews.text: Someone at Amazon thought it would be a good idea to make the clock tiny and non-changeable. That is the most important task this thing does is tell the time and you can't even see it. You can't change the clock, the size of the type or any font on the home screen. I called Amazon Echo Support, they said a lot of people where complaining about the same things, they didn't have any solution and politely thanked me for my feedback.... Mine is going back it's useless to me, if I can't see the time.
customer_reviews.author: Marc S.

customer_reviews.title: Stop senseless updates.  I lose more than I gain on most of them.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with 2nd generation Show. Most home screen options were removed. Can’t customize clock anymore. Constant “Try this” on bottom of screen is senseless. Can’t display personal recipes. You must use Allrecipes or Food network. Not as responsive as Echo. I have two Echos, one Dot. Love them. The Echo Show? Not so much. The constant updates that change the menus and choices on the entire Echo lineup is becoming tiresome. It appears as if someone at Amazon is trying to justify their jobs.
customer_reviews.author: WI Doorbell

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this for an elderly person unless they have a cellphone
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be a great idea for my 100 year old grandmother. Turns out she has to also have a cellphone number. Ok... that isn't happening, thanks for highlighting that as a requirement for this unit to function =\
customer_reviews.author: C. Hampson

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed at this product. I was very excited to utilize this at home, but I come to find out after trying to use it for something else other than music that Alexa doesn't seem to find anything online, its unable to show videos or music videos and its a hassle to link with other devices, when asked to do a task it takes three or for times for her to actually understand what you're saying or it gives you random information for an answer
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Amazon added 3 huge Features
customer_reviews.text: Amazon 2018 Echo Show has added 3 key features that improves the overall experience of the Echo Show - Larger display w/ better design, improved sound quality, and upgraded entertainment options. Took away one star - wish I didn't always have to repeat some commands. Needs to improve understanding commands. For those people who mentioned the clock/weather is TOO SMALL, please look at the last photo. You can magnify the clock/information by going to Settings > Accessibility
customer_reviews.author: Room + Goods

customer_reviews.title: I don’t want to return it but I
customer_reviews.text: This might seem like a small thing, but it’s enough to make me want to return it. It is IMPOSSIBLE to turn off the nerdy and annoying suggestions. If I want to try something I freaking will. They run all day all the time. So lame.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Gardner Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Need clock face support for across the room readability
customer_reviews.text: Please add clock face and weather display that is readable from across the room.
customer_reviews.author: araknid_y

customer_reviews.title: The good and the bad (but not that bad).
customer_reviews.text: I really like the larger 10.1 inch screen. But 720p really? The speakers are a lot better than than the 1st generation. And they get better the more you pump sound through them. And one big disappointment is that SiriusXM stations still do not show the artist, song or album. My Grace Digital can do that. At any rate I am happy so far. Also you can pair the Alexa remote to it. You just have to do it through on screen settings not the Alexa app tada....
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special. Mostly a source of frustration because it always says " hum I don't know that." Don't expect the video portion to work well for anything. Basically it's just good for music and the shopping list. Way over priced! Oh, over whelming amount of advertising included with your purchase. If you like junk mail this is for you. Update: more random advertisements at full volume when you least expect it. Mostly don't use it now.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: The screen is bigger and the sound is better, but that's it , so its definitely not worth spending the much higher price for it. It also stopped working after a week , so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank K.

customer_reviews.title: So far we love the echo shows
customer_reviews.text: So far we love the echo shows. My mom had a stroke a couple of years ago that left her unable to speak, therefore can not answer or talk on the phone. We got one to put in my mom's nursing home room so we can drop in on her without her having to speak to answer and the kids can tell her about their day or just say hello when we can't get over to visit. The speaker is phenomenal! I get better sound from the echo than I do from my stereo.
customer_reviews.author: jtolley

customer_reviews.title: Loyal customer enraged by product the doesn’t work (hyperbolic but true)
customer_reviews.text: Sound died about 20 minutes in to use. Connected to Internet — check. Restarted - check. Factory reset - check. Maybe it was connected to a bluetooth speaker and I couldn’t hear. Nope - check. It’s a first world problem but we work hard for our money and at a minimum expect that a product we buy works. PS - I’m standing here with my 14 yr son trying to figure this out and explain how sometimes things just get made cheap and “you get what you pay for” and realize that I sound like my dad. Please don’t make me sound like my dad. (Quick update: by some miracle, it worked this morning)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Wanke

customer_reviews.title: Great but very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Product looks awesome and great. But limited to things you can do. I was trying to replace it with my iPad but no apps to download. Nothing you can add too. This could be awesomeness but NOPE
customer_reviews.author: david frias

customer_reviews.title: I love them!
customer_reviews.text: I had a few issues with some of the ones I bought the first day they were available... but I got new ones and these are perfect. I am so in love with these things it's ridiculous. The only things I wish: -The "Calendar" card on the home screen would show me ALL of my events at a glance without me having to ask for my calendar. -Native support for Dark Sky as my weather source (with severe weather alerts) - the 3rd party app Big sky is an ok stop gap for now, but not good enough. -Added bonus would be Google tasks/reminders integration but that seems unlikely.
customer_reviews.author: Greg C

customer_reviews.title: Love the New Look
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the new look and sound. The quality of the upgraded speaker and screen gives you that small TV look and sound in the Kitchen. I'm looking forward to great experiences.
customer_reviews.author: Tea

customer_reviews.title: Useless device....
customer_reviews.text: After trying this device for a few months I've decided that it is the most useless device offered by amazon. The alexa/echo commands rarely work, tHe screen resolution is 1970's in appearance....I could go on but now I see that amazon has lowered the price substanially and I know why....
customer_reviews.author: B. Lynn Stubblefield

customer_reviews.title: Stupid Reminders on how to use Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Would have been a nice device to have but did you really have to put your "Try This..." into it. Send it back after using it for only a few hours and spending a lot of time talking with Amazon techs to resolve the problem. After a number of calls to Amazon I was finally told you cannot get rid of Try This... Stupid move on your part Amazon. Like a lot of other people commented: You can have a nice photo montage running and those idiotic Try This... keeps showing at the bottom of the screen. Had high expectations for this device and you shot it out of the sky.... Nice move dummies
customer_reviews.author: Twit

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money !!!
customer_reviews.text: Thought of giving a try to this new device from Amazon as an addition to echo dot. But it is just a big junk version of dot. It is not intelligent or intuitive like google home products. Never recognize the smart products by name, not performing tasks like "turn off room lights" when multiple lights are there in a single. It just keeps asking which device or telling multiple devices found. Even after updating the address in alexa app and device it is not able to find the location for weather alerts etc. On the other side if i give the same commands to google no question is asked and job is done. Will be returning this big box soon.
customer_reviews.author: valla4u

customer_reviews.title: very irritating and very much a problem
customer_reviews.text: I have a problem with YouTube after about maybe a minute and a half it reverts back to the home screen and I have to reset everything to get back to the YouTube video I’m sorry but I find it very irritating and very much a problem
customer_reviews.author: Scott C. Parker

customer_reviews.title: No skype or other video calling?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so i could video call on Skype and or face time or any other video chatting software and you can only video call alexa show to alexa show install the alexa app. It seems a little ridiculous that you cant call any other platforms? I am going to get the Facebook Portal instead because at least it uses a platform that is adopted. Please let me know if I am missing something!
customer_reviews.author: Sarasmith72

customer_reviews.title: Hey Get a new echo and watch it stay on the ECHO screen
customer_reviews.text: Got a brick. Now I am waiting 2 days for a new one. If you get one and it is like this....don't go through support. Just return and replace.
customer_reviews.author: mrmcc916

customer_reviews.title: Kept me in touch with my mom before she passed
customer_reviews.text: My mom lived in Hawaii, and I'm in California. Last Mother's day, I bought a pair of Echo Shows - one for me and one for my mom, and I'd randomly check in on her to see how she was doing. Because of the coronavirus, I couldn't fly out there to be with her as her health took a sharp decline. Echo Show gave me a way to be there and to "hang out" with my mom before she passed. I just dropped in on her and "hung out" with her for hours at a time. It was a precious gift to be there during her last days.
customer_reviews.author: KarKenPo

customer_reviews.title: No American Support
customer_reviews.text: These were very expensive given the fact that they come with this mini 7 page manual that doesn't explain anything. When I tried to call support, I was connected to someone overseas. If you've ever experienced this there's no need for me to explain the frustration. If they don't want all 4 of the echo shows I just purchased returned, a native English speaker will contact me via the phone number connected to my account.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Starts playing on its own constantly
customer_reviews.text: Makes me sad to 1 star this, but the device is now constantly starting to play music, recipes, news content all on its own. Over and over throughout the day. We mute the device and it just raises the volume up again. Basically at the point now where we’re just going to unplug it. It didn’t always do this, feels like something that’s escalated over time.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement over the first version
customer_reviews.text: Look, this is a beautiful product. Huge, High Def screen, great sound, etc. The only negative is - we're still waiting for fun exciting things to do with it. We hooked it up with LifX lights, Ring doorbell and cameras, and the new Amazon plugs. All that is great, you can turn things on and off, but with the exception of the Ring video, not much needs the beautiful screen. We use it to video chat with the kids & grandkids, and I think the stationary, hands free Echo is better for video chat than having to hold a phone. But let's get some more fun and interesting video content going!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve613

customer_reviews.title: Continual Hounded by the "Things to Try" and It Can't Be Turned Off
customer_reviews.text: Returning it because of the constant "Things to Try" notifications on the home screen. I contacted Cust. Service and there's no way to turn that off. Also, it's lousy at playing anything online, like a video on YouTube. The voice and image do not sync up. Not happy with this device, it's going back tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: A Reader 4455

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I have the previous version of Show as well as this new one. The sound is much improved and the monitor is great sized compared to the original. The biggest disappointment here is with the video interaction. Simply put, its a fail. I was looking forward to the Hulu option and even signed up for a new subscription just for this device. That said, the interface is essentially non-existant. its just awful. When watching on my ipad, i can access a full schedule, but on Show, there is no such option, only a list of the channels....doesnt even show what is currently playing. this product will never succeed if they dont address this video streaming fail. sad.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Hargraves

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with Home Screen Updated
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use the Echo as a bedside clock but the small clock/weather numbers are not adequate. Ease of use, integration with other devices and sound quality are all excellent. It seems like an update to include the same clock options that on the other Echo Show devices would not be too difficult. Updated: Posted review too soon before I allowed the screen saver to come on. The screen saver has an adequate clock for my purposes. I do wish there were other display options. My smart watch has numerous choices for displays.
customer_reviews.author: PVT

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible!!! Doesn’t “listen” as well as other devices. And if you want to use it for music eat all, the speakers/sound quality is far worse than a dot or other.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprise!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to break down and buy this...for me.....I am the techie one in the family.....but my 75 year old husband, as soon as I got it out of the box and played with it for about 5 minutes, I knew, it had to belong to him. He does nothing techie....but he does use my Echo all the time, his calender, music, timers, day and time, sports... He was so happy....still loves his flip phone, but loves his Show! Wished others in family his age had a show so he could call them and see them....to cool for school, is what I say!
customer_reviews.author: Tatertot

customer_reviews.title: Hate the forced "Try" recommendations at the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Have tried all suggestions on how to turn these off and none work. Many are really indirect advertisements "Try: Alexa what are the features of XYZ product. " None are wanted. Otherwise, nice screen and good sound. But can't believe people put up with this. Mine is going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: PLTK

customer_reviews.title: GET RID OF “THINGS TO TRY”!
customer_reviews.text: Include me with the people who hate “things to try” PLEASE Amazon, listen to your customers and make this an option! I enjoy using the Alexa products and appreciate their helpfulness and entertainment capabilities, but the Echoes with screens that constantly have things to try at the bottom are irritating. I just want to be able to look at the time, weather and see photos of my friends and family without Alexa pushing things to try at me. Please make a good product great- you have the ability!
customer_reviews.author: Denis-Mounie

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want leftist propaganda piped into your house
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty much pointless, except for showing the weather. If you like having leftist propaganda rammed down your throat, though, it’s great. To prevent an Echo Show from flashing leftist propaganda and BS about COVID-19 on the screen, go into settings and disable News, Trending Topics and COVID-19 tips. Here’s how: 1. Swipe down from top of screen. 2. Tap Settings. 3. Scroll down to News and switch off the toggle. On the same screen scroll to COVID-19 tips and switch off that toggle and also switch off toggle for Trending Topics.
customer_reviews.author: Ltb

customer_reviews.title: Find something else.
customer_reviews.text: This could be a decent device for watching cameras and other screen related tasks but unfortunately Amazon does not give you full control of this expensive device. They control it. You can not turn off the try this from the home screen and it is extremely annoying. I bought it, I want to decide what is on the home screen. I will not buy another echo device with a screen nor recommend one. If this was on a television and I could not turn it off I would quit watching television. There are thousands of complaints about this but of course they could care less. Find a different device if you need a screen.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ervin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Product
customer_reviews.text: It is nice product for what we wanted to use it for. It works like a kitchen TV at our house with our Hulu subscription. Only complaint is that the volume level is different by application. For example, Hulu sound may be just fine. Ask it to play music and it is really loud even though you have not adjusted the volume. Hopefully they fix this in a software update. Otherwise screen is good. I have it integrated with our home automation so it is nice to be able to tell Alexa to turn off the basement lights etc.
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Netflix is not supported by this device. Unable to use Facebook messenger on the echo show 2. This device sucks. I expected more from this device, I really wanted to like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great to use with Ring doorbell
customer_reviews.text: A little known function that doesn’t get its spotlight enough is the fact that the skills for the Ring doorbell on this device is amazing! When someone pushes the ring doorbell, the screen automatically alerts me that someone is at the door and brings up the image. While I’m not sure if other doorbell cameras have the same skills in Alexa, this is truly a great feature that is worth its weight in gold.
customer_reviews.author: Herrick Ross

customer_reviews.title: no sound
customer_reviews.text: plug it in, went through all the procedures for connecting NO SOUND, called AMAZON HELPLINE went through all the suggested walk through still no SOUND, FINALLY clerk on the line (sounds like a call center) tells me they are working on an update and will automatically send me the updates, whisky tango foxtrot.
customer_reviews.author: hole in one

customer_reviews.title: This is a must!
customer_reviews.text: So I was extremely skeptical of purchasing this because of the price, but ended up biting the bullet on Black Friday. With the one day delivery, I have it in my kitchen and completely set up. I am not tech savvy at all and this is so easy to use. The music quality is incredible. If you love cooking and using recipes as much as I do, this also does not disappoint. I am so happy within the first hour of playing around with this gadget.
customer_reviews.author: N.N.

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of the "Try.." line
customer_reviews.text: The home screen constantly rotates messages for you to "Try" on the Show. It is distracting and useless. I would not have bought the Show if I had known about it in advance. It is like having a TV constantly display messages for you to try some product or another. Nobody would knowingly buy that TV. Whomever at Amazon thinks it is a good idea should be re-educated. Give the user an option to turn off that dumb message. My advice to all: don't buy the Show until they change this.
customer_reviews.author: RetiredGuy

customer_reviews.title: A big improvment in every way
customer_reviews.text: This is better I every way to the old first generation echo show. The screen is better and clearer and if you love plenty of bass, this has it. The sound field is wide and will fill your room. It turns on my philps hue lights on slightly faster also. If you got the old show, the this is a worthy upgrade, everything about it is better, and for a 10" screen, because its so compact it does not look a monster like the Lenovo 10" smart screen, so love the smaller echo show form factor.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to receiving this, to use in my upstairs office to have videos and news shows on while I work. (as well as other things, since I already own three echo dots and love them) But after I got it plugged in and went through the installations, configurations and updates, there was NO SOUND. I looked in settings, all volume was up and enabled. There was NO documentation on sound issues, and no indication I would have to purchase external speakers. Shocking how little information there was on the issue in the tiny pamphlet included. IMMEDIATE RETURN.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Collum

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have any sort of home screens, no apps. Nothing like a tablet and nearly useless. Cannot preform searches. I get real tired of hearing alexa say "sorry, i don't know that". Amazon has purposely blocked things like netflix, even through the browser. This thing should be able to do everything the fire tv can... you cant even shop on amazon with it normally. you get some weirdly watered down version of everything. My $50 fire tablet is far superior to this $250 POS. Not worth the money. The Echo plus seems to understand commands better and do more things. NOT AT ALL what you'd expect from an amazon device. Regretfully purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy B

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Update to Prior Model
customer_reviews.text: I have used Alexa since the first one and I am delighted with the new Echo Show. The prior generation looked dated out of the box and featured a small screen, but it was the best version of a smart home speaker out there. When I opened the box to this one, I was impressed with the stylish design, beautiful front screen with no unsightly speaker under the screen like the prior model, and crisp sound. It is a wonderful device, and if you have the prior Show, it is a worthy upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Sound doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Brand new Echo Show ordered on Prime Day. Zero sound. Saw some online forums this week with other consumers reporting the same issue. Have tried rebooting device and triple checking Bluetooth/WiFi. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Tanasi

customer_reviews.title: No sound
customer_reviews.text: I’m not technologically incompetent by any means... I have hooked up close to 20 Alexas and echo dots .. I ordered this echo show on prime day and I set it up ( it was already pre reg’d to my Alexa device account) it connected to the WiFi at our house but I can not get any sound of of this device. It can hear me commanding but I can’t not hear anything. I took all other devices offline and off blue tooth but still no luck ! Amazon please offer advice and instructions
customer_reviews.author: Julie Rose Olivier

customer_reviews.title: It is an improvement over the original Show.
customer_reviews.text: I now have both the original 5" Echo Show and the 10.1" Echo Show. The larger screen, for my old eyes, is good especially for viewing WYZE camera Alexa Skill views while in bed. I'm also very pleased with the enhanced speakers and resultant sound. I could not find a review of the power consumption by the 10.1" Echo Show so I just used my Kill-A-Watt device to determine it pulls .09 amps, 5 watts at idle and 7 watts streaming WWOZ, a local community radio station. A most excellent improvement! And Alexa seems a bit more attentive with the new microphones, Good Girl!
customer_reviews.author: Matt D.

customer_reviews.title: Not working anymore after a year...
customer_reviews.text: We have all Alexa speakers (spot and dots) and this thing is crap. We own it now 1.5 year and it isn’t working anymore. We tried everything but always when you Wanne ask Alexa something the system is breaking up. Wonderful!!!! Can’t even listing to music anymore
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Martens

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Really Want It, Got Talked Into It
customer_reviews.text: Hated it. Everything it does, my phone already does. That whole "it's only listening when you wake it up" is bunk. It would light up the second it heard a footfall, any footfall, anywhere in the vicinity. Worst part, when I downloaded the app to my phone, it diverted phone calls, and I missed them. Do we really need every single thing connected? Seriously? I guess I'm now officially of that "your music's too loud and get off my lawn" generation. Expensive toy that is completely unnecessary. There is such a thing as too much tech.
customer_reviews.author: H. Lockett

customer_reviews.title: Loved the multiple timers you could set while cooking. But not the glitches
customer_reviews.text: I actually returned this item, I could only watch select prime videos and select Hulu videos, it did not have my list available and from time to time Alexa would not set timers and respond properly when asked stuff on a few occasions I had to unplug the power cord and plug back in for her to be responsive. For sure has some work needed to be done and I’d suggest getting Netflix and directv now service on it. Would of been the perfect size for my kitchen for cooking and videos but did not work out for me at this time, I think it’s needing much improvement before I would consider buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All functions seem to work but the sound. NO SOUND
customer_reviews.text: Absolute Garbage. Worked for 1 hour then sound no longer worked. Called help center but they could not do anything to fix it. Huge waste of money for something that does not live up to its hype. Really expected more from Amazon. Sending it back. Will look into google home.
customer_reviews.author: Harley

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed with this product. It's way over priced for the amount of functions that it offers, or should I say what it is incapable of offering! I should've stuck with the regular echo for $200 cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: Merry

customer_reviews.title: Echo - Not worth the value & No Customer Service to get repaired
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in this device. Even more disappointed in Amazon's lack of any customer service. Device less than 6 months old and begins to play music when its off, then begins videos when its supposed to be off. It hears me say something and then such sometimes what I mention appears on my device. I think there's a major lack of privacy by Amazon thus I'm selling my device on Craigslist and getting away from a device that listens and sometimes reacts to what ive said. Privacy is something everyone should be concerned about and zero customer service means not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: AUSTINITER

customer_reviews.title: Not a Player in Home Automation
customer_reviews.text: Amazon's technical support is non-existent. Until they straighten this out they will never be a true home automation system. I use Wink along with Alexa. In Wink I deleted many devices when I moved recently. I then went into Alexa a deleted the devices there. However, after less than an hour, all the devices show up again even though they no longer exist in Wink. Well, two calls to Alexa support and 'nothing'. Tech support was clueless. Wink says it's a Alexa problem and I believe them. I now have 60 devises that show up on Alexa that do not exist.
customer_reviews.author: BobCz

customer_reviews.title: Just buy a tablet it will perform way better
customer_reviews.text: This almost seems like a beta test item the user interface is horribly clunky they could’ve at least put the fire tablet OS on it. Not only is Alexa kind of clueless unless you ask her the prompted questions. The Hulu in her face sucks because I can’t click a show and then look at all the different episodes and seasons I just have to deal with whatever one is showing and there is no search functionality in it. There’s no YouTube and there’s also no Netflix which really doesn’t make sense on a device that has a large screen.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: No sound whatsoever!
customer_reviews.text: New Echo Show 2nd generation, arrived defective: no sound whatsoever! Upon installation, it updated its software, connected to wireless, but no audio. Checked that it wasn't muted and that mic was on. Did factory reset, still no audio. Sending it back to Amazon. Anyone else having this problem with this batch?
customer_reviews.author: Thoughtful

customer_reviews.title: No Sound!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift. So i hooked it up, ran it through the setup procedure, and.... no sound. "Alexa, tell me a joke". Joke shows up on the screen, but no sound. Called Amazon customer support, who advised that they are having a problem with Echo show 2nd gen. Asked me to wait until end of day to see if engineers come up with solution, but called back in an hour and asked me to send it back. So.... 1 star for sending out a product without adequately testing it, embarrassing me in the process.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba Bighatt

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Wish the screen wouldn’t timeout so fast or Atleast have an option that you could change that setting. Would like to be able to monitor my cameras without always asking Alexa. Overall this thing has everything. The sound quality is amazing. Picture quality is perfect. I’m still messing with it and trying to figure out how I can use this in everyday life as I’m slowly transitioning my house to be a full smart house. But for now with cooking and listening to music this thing is amazing. Add a screen time out setting and I’d give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: MIKEYP

customer_reviews.title: Alexia is DEFINITLY not smart!
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect Alexa to be anything like Siri or a search engine like google. 60% of the questions I ask, her response if "Hmm I don't know that one". For the price I paid, it isn't worth it. Google knows much more. Maybe the company should have considered putting in a search engine. That way, you a have 50% of getting the right answer. I had it put printing on for a screen saver. If you ask about the picture, she has NO clue what you are asking. Even Siri was smarter that that, I just don't like apple products.
customer_reviews.author: tiki888

customer_reviews.title: BUYERS BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box it had no audio, had it replaced and it worked. Ot sounded pretty good until it started acting buggy. Then no audio at all on anything. Now im waiting for a replacement. They made a ticket and still waiting. Apparently the factory that was making the units that I had gotten was shut down because all of the units from it were buggy. Im glad they hot shut down for it. I as well as others in my situation should not have to go through this. And wait impatiently for our replacement yet again. We should also get credits to our Amazon account for future purchases for all of this hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Soooooooo frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I love my amazon products and am slowly connecting everything in my house. I have multiple Alexa devices. The show is the most expensive and the most worthless. It is so frustrating that I want to return but passed return date. It can’t find anything and when you finally get where you want to go, like a recipe, as soon as you turn to get an egg it goes to home screen. My daughter asked me why I was yelling at Alexa. Don’t waste your money on this. It is completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Marquardt

customer_reviews.title: Make sure this unit's capabilities meet your expectations before buying.
customer_reviews.text: My expectations were rather too high here. Unfortunately, this Echo Show only has limited functionality, it has the Echo suite but then for streaming content is limited to Amazon Prime and Hulu only. No other streaming services are supported. I like to have a selection of news channels and not limit myself to NBC. You can link your Pandora account, but unless you specify when asking for a song to be played through Pandora it will attempt Amazon Music service 1st. Clunky when trying to voice menu search for recipe's etc. Will stick with my Fire tablet for now. On a positive note, speakers are awesome in quality.
customer_reviews.author: GWL

customer_reviews.title: Sound is bass-y
customer_reviews.text: The issue with this newer device, compared to previous version, is the sound quality; although it is 'improved', it is really just more bass-y in tone. Therefore, to me, the sound is not as clear as before. Also, when the music is more loud than not, it is difficult for Alexa to hear you when you want to pause, cancel, or change the song. I have been having to reduce the volume before Alexa will recognize that I am trying to make a change. This never happened with my previous device. Still, it is great to have such a device, but I am not sure I care for the 'improved' version for those reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Jr Lang

customer_reviews.title: Give a display to your Alexa assistant.
customer_reviews.text: A good 10” HD touch display and overall a nice product but this device is not even close when it comes to far field voice detection comparatively to Echo dot those are fabulous and most cost effective options if one doesn’t care about screen. Still lacks in so many features and there is always something which doesn’t work as expected but that’s the thing with any technology which is still evolving day by day. Long story short there is a lot of potential for this device can do better and the team needs to do better job for sure.
customer_reviews.author: S Singh

customer_reviews.title: NO SOUND
customer_reviews.text: Right out of box we have no sound what so ever. I have read where Amazon tells people to rest and so on but it ends up being a temp fix. Guess we will have to send it right back. What a let down......
customer_reviews.author: Jami Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Defected!
customer_reviews.text: Has no sound! I tried everything; Rebooting, restart, and factory reset and still has no sound!
customer_reviews.author: MajestikCouple

customer_reviews.title: ANOTHER FRAUD FROM AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: Got the Amazon Echo Show. It took 2 hours to set up just with passwords and accounts and all the other nonsense. Got the device for my mother to make calls. Then found out it can make calls out fine when it's paired with a smart phone BUT it doesn't allow calls IN unless it's from another echo device. Can't receive calls from other phones or mobile devices. WHAT A JOKE. PATHETIC. ALSO, when you're not using it, it shows ads. Really, really, really annoying. To buy a constant billboard of ads. Another pathetic amazon fraud.
customer_reviews.author: d roche

customer_reviews.title: Not as satisfied as I thought I would be
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. Can only video chat with one other device. For this to be worth the cost, it needs the ability to do video chats with multiple accounts at once. Bought 3 of these for myself, my mom, and my grandmother. At the very least we thought we could enable the zoom skill. But no... you have to pay for business zoom account. With social distancing a priority, please add this ability soon. The image quality is great as is the audio quality. The appearance is nice nnd modern. I do wish a stand was included that allowed tilting. For now, I have to prop a book under it to tilt it down enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amy K

customer_reviews.title: Privacy issue
customer_reviews.text: When I asked Alexa to call my dad, this Alexa automatically changes my command to “Drop-in”, and the call was automatically connected to my dad’s echo device and started showing the view of his echo device. I have checked the log and it shows Alexa recognized my command correctly. It’s more like a server end issue. I have contacted amazon on this matter but amazon has not sent me any conclusion yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S

customer_reviews.title: good screen and soind, but slow as hell and youtube and web videos work for only 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: The echo show 2nd gen 10.1, is slow, the youtube integration in the browser is the worst. You can play the web videos for not more than 5 minutes and the home screen ahows up after 5 minutes. Called the support on this issue, that is an another big review i have to write about the tech support on echo devices. The good , big screen and the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: TigerVas

customer_reviews.title: disappointing and annoying
customer_reviews.text: its ok, plays my audible books while im cooking, the “ things to try” feature, which it seems cant be turned off is so annoying. also unable to look at kindle recipe books, no alexa i dont want you to read it to me, show me the book ...... i got it mainly for drop in and calls while im cooking, ut i think its going back and ill just use my ipad instead. id have kept it and just made it work for me if wasn’t for the stupid things to try. and yes ive been all through the app and supposedly shut it off and yet they’re still there . disappointed, would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: kaprica 1

customer_reviews.title: Too slow
customer_reviews.text: This device is too slow to your commands. I also own two echo dots and they are capable of listening and responding to my voice almost instantaneously, you would expect that a higher end, newer designed device would have a better, faster response, but it doesn’t. I have to repeat the same command multiple times to receive the wrong response more than half the time. I feel like an idiot who’s talking to himself and no one is listening, not even a modern machine that is supposed to be designed to listen. You’re better off buying a tablet, just pair it with a good Bluetooth speaker and you’re golden. Trust me!
customer_reviews.author: Felian

customer_reviews.title: This device should be called "Things to try".
customer_reviews.text: Before you buy, make sure you don't mind rotating "Things to try" messages at the bottom of the screen. You can see them now in some of the product images. Just know you can't turn them off on the main screen. They just keep rotating and rotating and rotating. After reading the Alexa SDK docs, it is clear Amazon really likes this feature. It is core to their UX. See 8.2.2 at  After spending two days with the echo show, all I see now is "Try ... Google Home"
customer_reviews.author: C. Medley

customer_reviews.title: I didn't know I need this but now!!!
customer_reviews.text: At a recent visit to my son's apartment I noticed he had an earlier version of the Echo Show (the 5). I also noticed it had many uses. After a long conversation of how this could improve my life in my kitchen (where I spend a ton of time learning new recipes and creating new ones of my own, I knew I had to have it. So I put it on my birthday gift list and my sweet son bought it for me. It sings to me, sets my timer, teaches me new recipes, answers almost all of my questions, and the list goes on. I didn't know I needed it but now what would I do without it! lol
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Terrible! I should have just bought the Google home over this piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from RC Willey store during the Christmas holidays since they offered a no tax day. My worst regret ever. After using it for 4 months now, it has been pretty frustrating to keep repeating what you want it to do and often times it says "Unable to ....." Then after repeating it will do it. I should have gone for a Google home as my other friends have recommended. Turning on lights and TV is such a hassle when to get done with several attempts until she finally does it. Never buying another Alexa product again!
customer_reviews.author: flpnout

customer_reviews.title: Sound stopped working
customer_reviews.text: When it worked, it worked great. It would be nice to be able to shut Alexa off and not have a system listening all of the time. We bought, the system in August 19. Worked fine until Jan 20, then the sound quit working and I could not find a way to get the sound to return. I always liked the Amazon return policy and have used it a few times. I realize the system was over a month old, but it should work for a year. I could not find a way to return the system and get a system that works. That is all I wanted to do. Product is great. My Item is defective.
customer_reviews.author: R Knox

customer_reviews.title: Best item for elderly!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for m mother who had difficulties with an iPhone, not to mention all the scam calls she would get! She can make calls out on this to whomever she’d like, but only certain numbers can call in...just what she needed! She can video chat with her friends and family if she chooses or just speak to them like a regular phone. At one point she actually watched a movie on her SHOW. It is a bit difficult for her to remember that it is a machine and sometimes says too much when short and simple is necessary. Overall, it’s perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: 2Believe33

customer_reviews.title: great for many uses!
customer_reviews.text: Like this product a lot because it has so many uses. I have not tried out all of them yet, but the ones I have used work great! I had a nice video chat with my son who also has an echo show. it was a great way to see each other without actually being in the same room with each other! Can't wait to try some of the other uses I know it has! It plays music really well and has some killer recipes you can use! I would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon P

customer_reviews.title: No sound on all 3 replacements
customer_reviews.text: The echo show doesn't work. We have 2 replacements in 1 week because out of the box the audio never worked. Not a single sound, effect, or anything. Tech support have been nice and is sending yet again another replacement, but how can I trust a device that can't work out of the box 3 times in a row!! Love echo devices but until this bug is fixed it's a complete fail.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Sanghavi

customer_reviews.title: Love This
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today and I am impressed with the Display Quality on this thing is GREAT and the Sound. OMG the sound is incredible. 5 star for now and hopefully permanent. I have echo, echo dots and two echo shows. What can I say they are all great. I continue to fine new ways to use them in routines, timers, reminders, video calls, asking questions, I could go on and on and on. You get the idea. THEY ARE GREAT. Oh I even have two echo Flex's with motion sensors on them, one in the garage and one in the storage room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 85 y/o mother for Christmas. She is terrified of tech, so she was not pleased, but after showing her how easy it is to use, she loves it. After a day or two she is using it to make shopping and to-do lists, reminders, alarms, cooking timers, checking her calendar, reading recipes. Sorry if this turned into a review of my mother. The screen looks great and the audio is amazing. Very easy to set up once you connect to your Wi-Fi.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Dont get this unless you want an Alexa with pictures..
customer_reviews.text: got this for my wife, wanted something to cook with in the kitchen, sounded like you just say a recipe and alexa pulls it up for you to use... blah way more trouble than its worth.. lots of inbetween stuff needs to be done to just get a simple recipe to show.. she winds up using her phone to get the recipe she needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kothon

customer_reviews.title: Alexa at its best
customer_reviews.text: Well I think when you're reviewing this item it's really a matter of taste. You either like Alexa or you don't. For me, the sound is good (i'm not an expert on sound, so it wouldn't surprise me if you disagreed), the picture is good, and it just straight up works. I personally think the device is great. I like how it does food recipes and music. I don't really use it for smart home use, so I can't comment on that. It's a great device for what it is, and if you like Alexa, then you'll like this device.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Dawg

customer_reviews.title: Awful device, pure frustration
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with great excitement to be able to play prime movies while in the kitchen. Sadly this Alexa is very hard of hearing. Some commands went unnoticed. The worst was trying to get it to play Prime Movies. That's right Amazon's device could not play movies from it's own streaming service without us wanting to pull our hair out. Most of the time she ignored play commands, other times the movies would just never start even though she showed the movie, and said she would play it. 1 star is to generous.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua E. Emery

customer_reviews.title: We love the 2nd Generatiion Echo Show.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the video and the sound is great. We can view our lists, weather info, recipes, videos, our photos, etc. We haven't had our Echo Show very long so we are still discovering new uses. We will be adding a Ring doorbell to our system in the next few weeks. And my wife loves the Sandstone color. I would have preferred it in Charcoal but I don't always get what I want. HaHa
customer_reviews.author: RBartlett

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love my Echo Show
customer_reviews.text: I use my Echo Show everyday. I can't say enough good things about this device. I can play my music on it, when I am cooking it can look up information for me, it walks you through a recipe so you don't have to pull up your recipe while your hands are gooey, it hooked up to my Ring Doorbell so I can see who is at the door much quicker than I did using my cell phone. There are so many more things the Echo Show can do and I don't want to bore you with listing them all. Just buy one, you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: slim11361

customer_reviews.title: Hate It!
customer_reviews.text: You have no way of getting the pictures off the Echo once they are on. I downloaded my pictures and there are ones I forgot about and do not like. I cannot delete them! They are there forever. Also, Alexa wil show the same picture reel over and over again. You ask her for new photos and you get another short reel of other pictures over and over again. I have to turn Echo OFF to stop seeing the same thing every day!
customer_reviews.author: A. Gift For You

customer_reviews.title: Great but can’t use multiple devices with spotify
customer_reviews.text: Love it !!! Came 7 days early the sound is amazing only frustrating thing is I have Spotify not amazon music and if I use one Alexa device to play Spotify and can not then play on another device
customer_reviews.author: Kailaphx

customer_reviews.title: I've had it for only 3 months and now the problems begin
customer_reviews.text: 1. Cuts off mid-song then goes to the next selection. Sometimes just stops mid-song because it pauses itself, then restarts. 2. No matter how I set it, it keeps going to the "try this" page, scrolling constantly. Doesn't seem to be a way to keep it on home screen. And when it's scrolling it gives the little sound that says it's hearing me but right after, does the sound again and stops responding to my voice. It was a total mistake. I bought it end of August but going to try to get them to take it back and give me a credit for the 3rd general Echo speaker I just purchased. Total disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Pickles

customer_reviews.title: Well...
customer_reviews.text: Take this with a grain of salt since I didn't spend any time to train . But appliance was not user friendly. It does manage turning lights, fans on/off IF speak the connected utility ID clear enough for it to do it, otherwise get which one? And you have to repeat until it passes your pronunciation. You can't casually direct requests. In games it will only except the EXACT answer'vemg. If answer is New York City it may not accept it (wrong-answer is New York CITY), etc. Interface is not as smooth as I thought it would be. But again, I did not delve into perfecting my procedure, and just yell at it. Cats are more perceptive, intelligent and adaptive.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey J. Putterbaugh

customer_reviews.title: I can now read what Alexa says?
customer_reviews.text: I dislike how not useful it feels. Like I cant watch news apps or YouTube videos without using some hidden browser I have only been able to use once. It's just a dot with a screen to read the text that alexa says. It's also kind of clunky to use smart home devices. If it wasnt given to me as a gift I would have sent it back because I barely use it and feel like it's just a block taking up space on my counter.
customer_reviews.author: Squeaky

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I am getting use out of it and I enjoy having the screen feature vs the dot. It can stand being more of a versatile unit, say having internet access but then it would be something else and not the echo show. But I do like having it in my craft room where I can have access to something else besides music and sound. I recommend adding more channels for video entertainment options. If you want high end echo features and you are more visual this would be your choice.
customer_reviews.author: Tehachapi

customer_reviews.title: You NEED the Echo Show.  The sound is superb and visual display is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: The Echo Show is an awesome product. It's like having another person in the room, only waaaaay smarter. Great for keeping current on news and weather. Also nice for sports highlights, movies and television shows. Lots of amazing games and music / trivia attributes. Excellent device for streaming Sirius XM or any other on-line service. Alexa will play any song you ask her to. She is great. The perfect companion. There are so many more things I could say but will stop here.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hobson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect use for loved one in a facility
customer_reviews.text: Bought to put in my moms memory care facility room. Due to the COVID-19 it has been a lifesaver I have been able to check in and see her every single day and talk to her and see her it’s so easy. You use the drop in feature so she doesn’t have to touch any buttons it’s all run by the app on my cell phone- five stars
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Ann

customer_reviews.title: Quality build lacking responsiveness and some obvious skills
customer_reviews.text: First impression is it a quality device but still getting to know it. One observation is it takes a very long time to open camera views in the Blink skill and there is a serious lack of live video skills...hope there’s more coming. Seems like it should be easy enough have access to Playstation Vue or other.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Sound doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these. The sound doesn’t work on either one. I’ve walked through all troubleshooting w amazon and arranged for replacements. What a waste of time. I hope the new ones work.
customer_reviews.author: TBro

customer_reviews.title: EASY PEASEY!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are “seniors” and honestly, it was as easy as 1,2,3 to set up the new Echo Show. So much better than previous Echos and dots. Starting with the packaging which was phenomenal how it was engineering to fit this gem just perfectly. Instructions couldn’t have been easier, literally plug and go. We haven’t begun to tap into all the new features but are looking forward to trying them. Way to go Amazon! You got a winner with the Echo Show and better yet we were able to take advantage of Prime Day and a trade-in!
customer_reviews.author: Nonna

customer_reviews.title: Nest video doorbell and Echo Show lack compatibility features.
customer_reviews.text: I currently have an Echo Tower and Dot. In addition, I have the Nest thermostat and Nest doorbell. I purchased the Echo Show to display recipes, streaming videos, playing/displaying music, and displaying and letting me know when someone is at my door or ringing the doorbell. I love everything about the Echo Show, except for how it works with my Nest Doorbell. Echo show will not tell you or display, if someone is at your door or ringing your doorbell. I have to ask Alexa to show me the front door. I am very disappointed with the way Echo Show works with the Nest doorbell.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: I Got It, Amazon: Echo Has a Ton of Skills to Try
customer_reviews.text: The Echo Show is a great device nearly ruined by a poor software decision by Amazon. The device sounds great, is easy to set up, and is dead simple for home automation purposes. However, the bottom of the screen is interrupted by a constant advertisement from Amazon to try various Echo skills. This cannot be shut off. It's always there ruining the screen. It nearly caused me to dump the Echo ecosystem entirely and switch to Google (I still may...). If the constant advertisement doesn't bother you, consider this a 4/4.5 star review. I, however, believe I should be able to control all of the screen real estate and should be able to shut off things I don't like.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A lot of what I wanted, but will I use it?
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and very decent bass especially considering this unit’s size. The page slide is snappy and quick. The OS is android based and operates smoothly. The YouTube integration isn’t the best and still takes several steps to get to. The voice recognition is as good as it gets; however, I recommend selecting “short answers” to avoid having to listen to the rather long and drawn out default responses. Adding smart home devices is a breeze and so far I’ve added smart outlets, Wemo smart dimmer switches, Philips Hue bulbs and a couple of echo dots. I’ll continue to update this review as I get deeper into using it.
customer_reviews.author: JesseNYC

product_meta.title: Echo Show -- Premium 10.1” HD smart display with Alexa – stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
feature_bullets: Premium speakers with Dolby processing let you stream music and books in crisp, stereo sound. With a vibrant 10.1" HD screen for watching videos, movies, and TV shows in a new fabric design.
Make video calls to anyone with Skype, the Alexa app, an Echo Spot, or Echo Show.
Ask Alexa to see lyrics and album art with Amazon Music. See weather forecasts, calendars, to-do lists, and your favorite playlists.
Watch award-winning movies and shows from Prime Video, music videos from Vevo, or live TV and sports with a Hulu subscription.
Your new kitchen companion - cook along with Food Network Kitchen, set timers and alarms, and add items to your shopping list.
Set up compatible Zigbee devices without the need for a separate hub. See your front door camera stream with 2-way audio and notifications.
Built with multiple layers of privacy protections and controls, including a microphone/camera off button that electronically disconnects the microphones and camera.
With tens of thousands of skills and counting, Alexa is always getting smarter. Skills are like apps and let you do more with Alexa.
